meanings.definition: An ancient Greek wrestling school or gymnasium.
meanings.sent1: The palaestra in ancient Greece was where athletes trained for wrestling.
meanings.sent2: The local palaestra is a popular spot for young athletes to practice wrestling.
meanings.sent3: The palaestra was so busy that even the statues seemed to be wrestling each other!
meanings.sent4: His mind was a palaestra, grappling with new ideas and concepts.
meanings.sent5: The palaestra echoed with the sounds of bodies colliding and trainers shouting instructions.
